title: Critters 2: The Main Course
descriptions:
In Critters 2: The Main Course (1988), the mischievous, carnivorous alien furballs known as Crites return to the small town of Grover’s Bend two years after the first attack. Young Brad Brown, now a teenager, comes back to visit his grandmother and struggles with his reputation as the “boy who cried Critter.” Meanwhile, a local man unknowingly collects Crite eggs from an abandoned farmhouse and sells them as Easter decorations, leading to a disastrous holiday egg hunt when the eggs hatch into ravenous Critters.

Intergalactic bounty hunters Ug and Lee—shapeshifters who can assume human and pop-culture forms—receive a summons to finish the job they left incomplete. They enlist Brad’s help, but local authorities and townsfolk initially dismiss the threat. As the Critters multiply, they terrorize diners, churches, and back roads, rolling in packs and devouring anything edible. Lee cycles through identities in search of a suitable face while Ug, typically stoic and powerful, later loses his confidence after a teammate’s death rattles him.

The town’s eccentric reporter, hungry for a story, and a fast-talking hustler who helped distribute the eggs complicate matters. Ultimately, Brad allies with former town sheriff Harv to coordinate a defense. The group lures the swarming Critters to a burger factory with the promise of an all-you-can-eat feast, then rigs the building with explosives. In a signature set piece, the Crites merge into a giant rolling ball of fur and teeth, mowing down anything in its path, before the plan culminates in a fiery detonation that wipes out the brood.

With the immediate threat ended, Ug regains his resolve, the town begins to rebuild, and Brad departs again, having proven that the Critters were real and that courage can come from unlikely places. The film blends creature-feature horror with broad comedy, practical effects gags, and small-town satire, escalating the original’s mayhem into a fast-paced monster romp.
